thread.title: Oroville, California: Residents below dam ordered to evacuate
thread.title_full: Oroville, California: Residents below dam ordered to evacuate | Daily Telegraph

author: Ian Horswill
title: Oroville, California: Residents below dam ordered to evacuate
text:
AROUND 188,000 people have been evacuated in northern California as the emergency spillway of the tallest dam in the United States threatens to fail.
The auxiliary spillway at the Oroville Dam , about 125km north of Sacramento, had suffered severe erosion, the National Weather Service said in an alert — and its failure “would result in an uncontrolled release of flood waters from Lake Oroville.”
Residents below the dam near the city of Oroville in Butte County , California, were ordered to evacuate.
“Immediate evacuation from the low levels of Oroville and areas downstream is ordered,” the Butte County Sheriff said in a statement posted on social media. “This in NOT A Drill. This in NOT A Drill. This in NOT A Drill.”
Yuba City, with a population of 65,500, was evacuated along with Gridley, Live Oak, Marysville, Oroville, Wheat land, Plumas Lake, and Olivehurst — all cities downstream of Oroville Dam.
Evacuation centres have been set up at the Silver Dollar Fairgrounds in nearby Chico for the 16,000 residents of Oroville.
In its original evacuation order the Butte County Sheriff’s Office said the emergency spillway could fail within an hour unleashing uncontrolled flood waters and everyone living downstream had to get out immediately.
media_camera Water flows down Oroville Dam's main spillway, near the city of Oroville in California. Picture: AP / Rich Pedroncelli Over five hours later, hundreds of cars carrying panicked and angry people were sitting in bumper-to-bumper traffic. Hotels were booked out and petrol stations were running out of fuel.
“The police came and told us to evacuate,” Kaysi Levias who was with her husband, Greg, at a petrol station as they attempted to flee.
Officials warned residents that the spillway could fail within an hour.
“I’m just shocked,” Greg Levias said. “Pretty mad.”
“Not giving us more warning,” said Kaysi, finishing his sentence.
“We’ve never been through this before,” said Kaysi Levias. “We have two boys and our dog. All the stuff we could fit in the trunk — clothes and blankets.”
State Fire and Rescue Chief Kim Zagaris said at least 250 law enforcement officers from throughout California are in the area or en route to help keep safe the goods of those who have evacuated.
#BREAKING : This is the latest update from the Butte County Sheriff's Office. #OrovilleSpillway #OrovilleDam pic.twitter.com/4A6ltZEt4e
— BreakingNewsHQ (@BreakingNewsHQ1) February 13, 2017 Water floods Oroville roads as emergency spillway failure expected 0:58 Emergency evacuations were ordered for Oroville, California, on February 12, as authorities warned that they expected the Oroville Dam emergency spillway to fail. For the first time ever, water began running over the emergency spillway around 8 am, on Saturday, February 11. The dam, located on Oroville Lake, is the tallest in the United States and it was the first time the emergency spillway was used in the reservoir?s nearly 50-year history. A 200-foot long, 30-foot-deep hole had formed in the emergency spillway, according to reports. The California Department of Water Resources announced on Sunday that they were using helicopters to drop large rocks to fill the hole. Emergency evacuations were underway on Sunday for counties surrounding the Oroville Dam. According to California?s Department of Water Resources: ?The concern is that erosion at the head of the auxiliary spillway threatens to undermine the concrete weir and allow large, uncontrolled releases of water from Lake Oroville.? Credit: Luke Buell via Storyful
February 13th 2017 6 hours ago /video/video.news.com.au/News/Weather/ Water floods Oroville roads as emergency spillway failure expected Oroville dam burst
